questions.text: What is the original color of Coca-Cola?
Which of these was not first invented by a woman?

questions.explanation:
a goat.

	An ibex is an animal which belongs to the wild goat species. They have curved black horbs and like some other animals, they live independently and go together only during the mating season.

questions.text: What is another name for a polygraph?
When did the first refrigerator for home use appear?
questions.explanation:
1913.

	In America that year, the first model on the market was the Domelre, an electrically-powered machine manufactured in Chicago. In Europe the same year, the German electrical giant AEG of Berlin offered the first refrigerator. It was in 1918 that Kelvinator was introduced and 1923 when Frigidaire introduced the first self-contained household refrigerator.

questions.text: What name is given to the Thursday before Easter to commemorate Jesus' Last Supper with his disciples?
questions.explanation:
Maundy Thursday.

	It comes from the Old French mande (commanded from), from the Latin mandatum (commandment), which, in turn, is from the Latin for Jesus' words in John 13:34 : Mandatum novum do vobis (A new commandment I give unto you).

questions.text: What is the only food that does not spoil?
How old was Jesus' when he was crucified?
Who patented his Halitosis Detector Device in 1989?
questions.explanation:
Katumori Iwatsuki.

	The Halitosis Detector Device produces a signal corresponding to the malodorous degree of bad breath. The word halitosis, derives- etymologically- from the Latin halitus, meaning breath.

questions.text: What is the fatal disease in cattle that was detected in 1985 by a veterinarian contacted by a farmer in England who was puzzled by the behavior of one of his cows (please just the poular name we all know ...)?
questions.correct: Mad cow disease & mad cow disease & Mad Cow & mad cow & BSE & Bovine spongiform encephalitis
questions.explanation:
Mad cow disease & mad cow disease & Mad Cow & mad cow & BSE & Bovine spongiform encephalitis.

	The word Spongiform because the brains of infected cattle become spongy or full of holes. It was identified as BSE or Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy by Britains Central Veterinary Laboratory.
